marketNews.title: Kemendag Usul Bea Masuk hingga 200% untuk Keramik China
marketNews.content: The Anti-Dumping Committee of Indonesia (KADI) from the Ministry of Trade (Kemendag) on July 2, 2024, recommended an Anti-Dumping Import Duty (BMAD) rate of approximately 100.12-199.88% for ceramic imports originating from China. This recommendation was given after KADI concluded that there was a causality between the loss suffered by the domestic ceramic industry and the dumped goods from China. Currently, imported ceramics are subject to Safeguard Import Duty (BMTP) of 13% through Minister of Finance Regulation (PMK) No.156/PMK.010/2021, valid until November 2024. Despite this, the price of ceramics made by the domestic industry still cannot compete with the price of imported ceramics from China. Based on KADI's report, ceramic imports from China contributed to 41% of national consumption during the July 2021-June 2022 period, while 49% came from domestic sources and the remaining 10% from imports from other countries. Responding to this recommendation, the Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramics Industry Association (Asaki), Edy Suyanto, told Investor Daily that the results of KADI's investigation reflect fairness and government support for the sustainability of the national ceramic industry. Edy explained that the domestic ceramic industry has been severely hit by imported products, reflected in the factory utilization rate which dropped from 75% in 2022 to 63% in 1H24. Until now, it is still unknown when the Minister of Finance Regulation (PMK) related to BMAD will be implemented. Today, Friday (5/7), the Minister of Trade, Zulkifli Hasan, said that the government will still investigate a wider range of goods from various countries besides China that will subsequently be subject to BMAD. Besides ceramics, Zulkifli also said that his team will monitor textile, apparel, footwear, cosmetic, and electronic imports. On another note, Edy mentioned that he is confident that the grace period between the KADI report and the implementation of BMAD will be utilized by importers to conduct massive imports to avoid import duties. Key Takeaway: We assess that the implementation of the BMAD policy will have a positive impact on domestic ceramic producers such as Arwana Citramulia ($ARNA) and Cahayaputra Asa Keramik ($CAKK), considering that the price of Chinese imported ceramics will rise in line with the BMAD tariff. Consequently, local ceramic prices will become more competitive compared to Chinese ceramic products, potentially increasing demand volume, factory utilization, and company profitability. On the other hand, the potential exploitation of the grace period by importers could increase the stock of Chinese imported ceramics domestically. If this occurs, it could create a lagging effect between the implementation of BMAD and the increase in domestic ceramic industry sales volume.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Reportedly Seeking US$1.5 Billion Loan for Mine Expansion
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reports that Amman Mineral Internasional is seeking a loan of up to 1.5 billion US dollars to expand the Batu Hijau mine. Bloomberg sources stated that AMMN has secured commitments from several banks, including Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) and Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), for this loan. An AMMN spokesperson declined to comment on the matter.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Signs Coal Mining Services Term Sheet Amendment with SINI Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: Petrosea ($PTRO) signed amendments and restated the term sheet for a coal mining services agreement with Singaraja Putra's ($SINI) subsidiary, PT Pasir Bara Prima. Based on the update, the contract duration is extended to the life of mine with an estimated value of 1.08 billion US dollars. Furthermore, the estimated overburden removal production increased to 415.4 million bcm and coal production to 52 million tons. Previously, PTRO and PT Pasir Bara Prima signed a mining services term sheet on March 27, 2024, valued at 511.45 million US dollars until 2032, with estimated overburden production of 240 million bcm and coal production of 26.4 million tons.

tickerNews.title: PT Bakrie Metal Industries Reduces VKTR Stake via Share Sale
tickerNews.content: VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas shareholder, PT Bakrie Metal Industries, sold 3.09 billion VKTR shares at an undisclosed price on June 24, 2024. Following this transaction, PT Bakrie Metal Industries' ownership in VKTR decreased from 22.05% to 14.98%.

tickerNews.title: PT PP Records New Contract Value of IDR 9.5 Trillion in 1H24
tickerNews.content: PT PP ($PTPP) recorded new contract value of 9.5 trillion rupiah (-18.2% YoY) during 1H24, equivalent to 29.7% of the 2024 target set at 32 trillion rupiah. This result was dominated by road and bridge infrastructure projects, contributing 54.41%, while building projects contributed 39.57%, and the remainder from other projects.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Shares Will Not Enter Special Monitoring Board Despite 3-Month Price Stagnation at Rp 50
tickerNews.content: IDX Director, Jeffrey Hendrik, stated that GoTo Gojek Tokopedia shares will not enter the special monitoring board with a full call auction trading mechanism despite stagnating at the price of 50 rupiah per share for three consecutive months. Jeffrey explained that this is because GOTO share trading remains liquid, with an average transaction value above 5 million rupiah per day. Previously, the IDX revised the criteria for the special monitoring board on June 21, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Serpong Damai Controller Buys ~7.03 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Bumi Serpong Damai ($BSDE), PT Paraga Artamida, purchased approximately 7.03 million BSDE shares at an average price of 953 rupiah per share between June 27 and July 2, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 6.7 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Paraga Artamida's ownership in BSDE increased from 40.16% to 40.20%.

tickerNews.title: NFC Indonesia Subsidiary ESB Receives Pre-Series A Investment from LX Ventures and SAIC Capital
tickerNews.content: NFC Indonesia ($NFCX) announced that its subsidiary, PT Energi Selalu Baru (ESB), received investment from LX Ventures and SAIC Capital in a pre-Series A funding round. The total investment value was not disclosed. ESB plans to utilize this investment to develop the Volta electric vehicle fleet and expand the battery exchange infrastructure.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia's Foreign Exchange Reserves Rose to US$140.2 Billion at the End of June 2024
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of June 2024 increased to US$140.2 billion (vs. May 2024: US$139 billion). This increase was influenced by tax and service receipts and government foreign loan drawdowns, amidst the need for rupiah exchange rate stabilization. The position of foreign exchange reserves is equivalent to financing 6.3 months of imports or 6.1 months of imports and government foreign debt payments.

tickerNews.title: Prabowo-Gibran Government Has Only 2 Options to Increase Fiscal Capacity: Increase State Revenue or Prioritize Spending
tickerNews.content: The Executive Director of the Institute for Development of Economics and Finance (Indef), Esther Sri Astuti, stated that the Prabowo-Gibran administration only has 2 options to increase fiscal capacity, namely by increasing state revenue or prioritizing priority spending. Esther mentioned that the Prabowo-Gibran administration will bear a maturity debt burden of 3,749 trillion rupiah in 2025-2029 along with an increase in Indonesia's debt-to-GDP ratio from 30.6% in 2019 to 39.3% in 2023.

tickerNews.title: DPR Budget Committee Proposes Additional Budget of IDR 598.9 Trillion for Ministries/Institutions in 2025 RAPBN
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the DPR Budget Committee, Said Abdullah, stated that 11 commissions in the DPR proposed that ministries and institutions receive an additional budget of 598.9 trillion rupiah in the 2025 State Budget Draft (RAPBN). This proposal was submitted after several ministries and institutions requested additional budgets from the 2025 ceiling. Nevertheless, Said asked the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, to ensure that this additional budget does not increase the consolidated 2025 RAPBN deficit, which has been agreed upon to be around 2.29-2.82%.

tickerNews.title: Minister of ESDM Claims First RKEF Smelter 100% Owned by Indonesian Shareholders Will Soon Operate
tickerNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Arifin Tasrif, claimed that the first RKEF smelter 100% owned by Indonesian shareholders will soon operate. The smelter—owned by PT Ceria Nugraha Indotama (CNI)—is located in Kolaka Regency, Southeast Sulawesi, and is the first smelter in Indonesia financed by national banking, namely Bank Mandiri ($BMRI). Arifin mentioned that the smelter, with a capacity of 252,700 tons per year, will begin commissioning at the end of 2024. Previously, CNI disclosed plans to IPO on the IDX in 1H25.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy Optimistic Foreign Tourist Visits Can Reach 14 Million in 2024
tickerNews.content: Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy, Sandiaga Uno, stated that his ministry is optimistic that total foreign tourist visits to Indonesia can reach 14 million in 2024, driven by collaboration with tourism business actors. The figure of 14 million foreign tourist visits was the initial target set by the government for 2024. However, in February 2024, Sandiaga raised the 2024 foreign tourist visit target to 17 million. During 5M24, BPS recorded that foreign tourist visits to Indonesia increased by +23.78% YoY to 5.24 million, which only fulfilled 30.8% of the 17 million target.

tickerNews.title: SRAJ Plans Private Placement of Up to 1.2 Billion New Shares for Debt Repayment and Hospital Project Development
tickerNews.content: Sejahtera Anugrahjaya ($SRAJ) plans to conduct a private placement of up to 1.2 billion new shares with an dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The exercise price and prospective investors have not yet been announced, while the funds raised are intended for debt repayment to SRAJ's controlling shareholder, PT Surya Cipta Inti Cemerlang, and the development of Mayapada hospital projects in Jakarta, Batam, and Surabaya. This plan will be discussed at the Independent GMS on August 12, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Pilkada Serentak 2024 Remains on Schedule Following Dismissal of KPU Chairman
tickerNews.content: Coordinator of Presidential Special Staff, Ari Dwipayana, stated that the implementation of the 2024 simultaneous regional elections (Pilkada) remains on schedule and is unaffected by the dismissal of KPU Chairman, Hasyim Asy'ari. The KPU has appointed Mochammad Afifuddin as Acting KPU Chairman to replace Hasyim Asy'ari effective July 4, 2024. Previously, Hasyim Asy'ari was dismissed by the Election Organizer Honorary Council (DKPP) after being proven guilty in a sexual harassment case against an election organizer member.
